#summary hasXXX(...)
#labels api,1.0

*Category*:

[ModelObjectFunctions Model Object Functions]

*Description*:

Dynamic shortcut method, see [exists exists()] for more info. Replace `XXX` with the name of an association you have set up through [hasOne hasOne()], [hasMany hasMany()] or [belongsTo belongsTo()].

*Examples*:

{{{
<!--- a "belongsTo" association from "comment" to "post" is required --->
<cfset aComment = model("comment").findByKey(params.commentId)>

<cfset commentHasAPost = aComment.hasPost()>
=
<cfset commentHasAPost = model("post").exists(aComment.postId)>
}}}

{{{
<!--- a "hasOne" association from "user" to "profile" is required --->
<cfset aUser = model("user").findByKey(params.userId)>

<cfset userHasProfile = aUser.hasProfile()>
=
<cfset userHasProfile = model("profile").exists(where="userId=#aUser.id#")>
}}}

{{{
<!--- a "hasMany" association from "post" to "comments" is required --->
<cfset aPost = model("post").findByKey(params.postId)>

<cfset postHasComments = aPost.hasComments()>
=
<cfset postHasComments = model("comment").exists(where="postId=#aPost.id#")>
}}}
